result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Berg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
This sentence is to be served consecutive to any sentence in being.
This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH.

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution in the amount of $2417.64 to Austin Hanus; joint and several with co-actor Nicholas Schuster
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars or taverns
--not to possess or consume any alcohol or illegal drugs
--subject to monthly testing for illegal drug use
-No Contact with Austin Hanus or Adam Kolp
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--not to possess any dangerous weapons

Arresting Agency: WTPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

  Pursuant to Wis. Stats. 303.01(8), and to facilitate the rehabilitative objective of sentencing, the Department of Corrections shall deduct 25% from inmate wages to pay restitution as ordered by the court.

Cases 15CF32 and 15CF104 called together at 9:09am [mo]
Defendant David J Berg in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; pleas of "  Guilty " entered on Counts #1 and #2 in the Information for case 15CF32; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Berg guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Counts #3, #4, and #8 in Case 15CF32 and Case 15CF104
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--ADA Shock submits Victim Impact Statement
--ADA Shock plays surveillance video; start 9:22am-end9:26am(no audio)[marked as State's exh. #1]

On Count #1 in the Information for Case 15CF32:
The Court sentences Mr. Berg   to 6   years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years &   6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years &  6  months.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to any sentence in being. This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH.

On Count #2 in the Information for Case 15CF32:
The Court sentences  Mr. Berg  to    years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years &  6  months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years & 6   months. This sentence is to be served concurrent to the sentence in count #1 in Case 15CF32 

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
The Court gives  2   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars or taverns
--not to possess or consume any alcohol or illegal drugs
--subject to monthly testing for illegal drug use
-No Contact with Austin Hanus or Adam Kolp
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay restitution in the amount of $2417.64 to Austin Hanus; joint and several with co-actor Nicholas Schuster
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--not to possess any dangerous weapons 


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 10:07am

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV: 
cases #15CF32 and #15CF104 called at 2:17pm.
Defendant David J Berg in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Humes summarizes the limited progress made at Pretrial Conference; there is a need for the parties to view surveillance video and there has been a problem with being able to play the subject video.
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling.  Attorney Humes requests that a Status Conference be scheduled in approximately 60 days, however the Court notes that the cases are at Preliminary Hearing stage and the Court sets the cases for Prelims.
The Court continues the Bond.
recess 2:20pm.

Case called at 1:48pm[MO & MK]
Judge Koschnick presides for Branch II
Defendant David Berg appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Serivice Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $10,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--not to committ any acts of violence or make any threats
--no possession of dangerous weapons
--no contact with the co-defendant Nicholas Schuster except with a lawyer
--no contact with Austin Hanus, Cara Tetzlaff, Brynn Neevel or Jessica Melchior, except with a lawyer
--no presence at Gasthaus Bar
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

recess 1:54pm  


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 2/18/2015 at 10:40am   (2) Status Conference on 3/5/2015 at 3:00pm
